1.description: One of Japan’s two main jujutsu schools, dedicated to training sorcerers

sublocations.name: Isolation Chamber
sublocations.description: A talisman-covered cell used for secret executions, once holding Yuji and Yuta.

sublocations.name: Dormitory
sublocations.description: Large personal rooms for students, customizable; many remain unused due to low student numbers.

sublocations.name: Morgue
sublocations.description: Facility where fallen sorcerers’ bodies are brought back for mourning and proper disposal.

sublocations.name: Hidden Room
sublocations.description: A concealed room used by Gojo to hide and train Yuji; later a regrouping spot for students.

sublocations.name: Foothills of Mount Mushiro
sublocations.description: The entrance path to the school, a long staircase through torii gates beyond Tengen’s barrier.

3.description: A secured facility used to store cursed tools and objects. Its concealment barrier was breached by both curses and sorcerers, and after Shibuya most items were claimed by the Zenin and Kamo clans.

4.description: One of Japan’s two main jujutsu schools, dedicated to training sorcerers.

5.description: A local high school attended by Yuji, Iguchi, and Sasaki. Home of the Occult Research Club, which accidentally unsealed one of Sukuna’s fingers, causing a cursed spirit outbreak across the school.

6.description: The hospital where Yuji’s grandfather spent his final days in 2018. After giving Yuji his last advice to use his strength to help others, he passed away peacefully.

7.description: A major Tokyo ward and the main setting of the Shibuya Incident Arc, known for its commercial, business, and nightlife districts, with Shibuya Station as a central landmark.

sublocations.name: Bunkamura Way (Dogenzaka)
sublocations.description: A street near Shibuya Station where many civilians were trapped early in the Incident, later serving as battlegrounds for Megumi, Shigemo, Sukuna, and Mahoraga.

sublocations.name: Aoyama Cemetery (Harajuku)
sublocations.description: A prominent cemetery in Harajuku near Meiji-Jinguemae Station, used as the Mei Mei Team’s initial position during the Shibuya Incident.

sublocations.name: Meiji-Jinguemae Station
sublocations.description: The station connecting Meiji and Jinguemae. Was the entry point where Yuji entered the station and exorcised Ko-guy.

sublocations.name: Shibuya Tower
sublocations.description: A forty-story skyscraper with a rooftop helipad, notable battleground for Yuji, Megumi, Awasaka, and Ogami’s forces.

sublocations.name: Metropolitan Expressway, Route No. 3: Shibuya Line
sublocations.description: Highway near Shibuya Tower where Yuji and Megumi fought Awasaka; later used as a medical base with Shoko Ieiri stationed there.

sublocations.name: Shoto Bunkamura Street
sublocations.description: Road with substations near Shibuya Station; Nobara and Akari encountered Shigemo here before Nanami intervened inside the Bunkamura substation.

sublocations.name: Dogenzaka Alley
sublocations.description: A narrow alley where Nobara fought Mahito’s clone, injuring his soul before he retreated to Shibuya Station.

sublocations.name: Commercial District
sublocations.description: One of Shibuya’s shopping areas, later a dangerous no-man’s-land; Yuta Okkotsu rescued a child here while exorcising a lurking cursed spirit.

sublocations.name: Shibuya Station
sublocations.description: The main railway hub in Shibuya, connected to multiple complexes like Hikarie and Tokyu Department Store. During the Shibuya Incident, it became a central battlefield, including Yuji’s fight with Choso and Gojo’s eventual sealing.

sublocations.name: Jr. Shibuya Station
sublocations.description: A substation of the main complex, located near Shin Minami with Caffe Velace nearby; initial posting site for Team Kusakabe.

sublocations.name: Hikarie Building
sublocations.description: A landmark shopping and office complex in Shibuya, connected underground to the Fukutoshin Line. Thousands gathered here during Halloween Night.

sublocations.name: Fukutoshin Line Platform
sublocations.description: Located on B5F beneath Hikarie, this underground railway platform was the site of Gojo’s battle against Mahito’s allies and the sealing of Gojo in Prison Realm.

sublocations.name: Bunkamura Station
sublocations.description: Parallel subway lines under Shoto Bunkamura Street; battleground where Nobara and Nitta faced Shigemo before Nanami intervened after saving Ijichi.

8.description: A major Tokyo ward and the main setting of the Shibuya Incident Arc, known for its commercial, business, and nightlife districts, with Shibuya Station as a central landmark.
